body:
We are seeing the same thing here. Not allocating black (or "as old" as you
say) isn't the problem, the problem is that the mutator is hiding a pointer
from the GC long enough for the GC to make it to mark termination where it
finds the hidden pointer along with the large untraced list it is connected
to.

On Wed, Jul 22, 2015 at 4:52 AM, Sokolov Yura <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I tried to force "allocate as old" earlier by setting gcBlackenPromptly
> before concurrent mark event starts. It didn't help.
> (I did split gcBlackenPromptly into two flags, introducing gcBgmark1Done).
> (perhaps i've made a mistake somewhere).
